<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 17"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Hungering Maw](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2109)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Talisman" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=155" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 94 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 2,200 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** affixed to armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Free Action" /><row>([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561))</row></row>

 

**Trigger** You attempt a saving throw against a [possession](/Traits.aspx?ID=129) effect

**Requirement** You are a master in Will saves.
</row>

</column>

---

A shining onyx gemstone clutched in a pair of black steel jaws, this pendant is a potent defense against hostile spirits and other beings who commandeer the bodies of others. When you Activate it, you gain a +4 item bonus to your saving throw against the triggering effect. If your result prevents you from being possessed, the creature that attempted to possess you is subject to a DC 37 [_bind soul_](/Spells.aspx?ID=21) spell, which can trap it in the talisman as if it had recently died. The talisman's magic is exhausted after use, but a soul trapped this way remains imprisoned inside, as detailed in the spell description. Starting at the end of its next turn, the trapped creature gets a new save to end the effect at the end of each of its turns.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Hungering Maw
requirement: You are a master in Will saves.
